greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product{d|n} mu(d), product over positive divisors, d, of n, where mu(d) = Moebius function (A008683).
comment: Absolute value of a(n) = absolute value of mu(n).
Not multiplicative: For example a(2)*a(15) <> a(30). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 31 2012
Row products of table A225817. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 30 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 0 if mu(n) = 0; a(n) = -1 if n = prime; a(n) = 1 if n = squarefree composite or 1.
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[MoebiusMu[d], {d, Divisors[n]}]; Array[a, 106] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 22 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) f := function(n); t1 := &*[MoebiusMu(d) : d in Divisors(n) ]; return t1; end function;
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 08 2002
